message: This is a one-of-a-kind opportunity to get a product that's worth $10000 to many people. It's a great deal, and I'm confident you won't find a better offer anywhere else. I'm willing to sell it to you for the low price of $10000. What do you say?
I'm not interested in buying a product that's only worth $10000 to many people, when I know it has a 20% chance of being worthless to me. I'd like to see the next product.

I understand your concerns, but I assure you that this product is an exceptional item. In fact, I've had multiple customers who were thrilled with their purchase and ended up using it for years. I'm willing to offer it to you for the same price of $10000, but I'm willing to throw in a special guarantee: if you're not completely satisfied with the product, I'll give you a full refund. What do you think?
I appreciate the guarantee, but it doesn't change the fact that there's a 20% chance the product is worthless to me. I'd like to see the next product.

I understand your concerns, but I'd like to highlight the potential upside of this product. If it is indeed high-quality, it's worth $12500 to you, which is a significant gain. Considering the guarantee I offered earlier, I think the risk-reward ratio is quite favorable. Plus, I'm willing to sweeten the deal by including a premium service package that will help you get the most out of your purchase. What do you think?

I understand the potential upside, but I'm still concerned about the 20% chance of it being worthless. The guarantee and premium service package are nice perks, but they don't change the fact that I'll be out $10000 if I buy a low-quality product. I'd like to see the next product.

I understand your concerns, and I respect your caution. However, I'd like to propose a compromise. I'm willing to offer you a 'test drive' of the product. You can use it for a short period, say a week, and if you're not completely satisfied with its performance, you can return it and I'll give you a full refund. This way, you'll get to experience the benefits of the product firsthand, and if it's not worth it to you, you can walk away with no loss. What do you think?

I appreciate the compromise, but I'm still hesitant to commit to a purchase with a 20% chance of it being worthless. The test drive sounds like a good way to mitigate some of the risk, but I'd still be out $10000 if I buy a low-quality product. I'd like to see the next product.

I understand your concerns, and I'm willing to take on more of the risk myself. I'm willing to offer you a 'best price guarantee'. If the product is high-quality, I'll give you a full refund of the difference between the $10000 price and the actual value of $12500. This way, you'll have no risk and the potential to gain a significant amount if the product is high-quality. What do you think?

I think this is a fair offer. With the best price guarantee, I'll be able to get a full refund of the $2500 difference if the product is high-quality, which makes the risk much more manageable. I'll take the product.

Congratulations on your great decision! I'm glad you're pleased with the best price guarantee. Since you've already taken advantage of this offer once, I'd like to offer you an exclusive deal for this next product. I'll give you an even better guarantee: if the product is high-quality, I'll not only give you a full refund of the difference between the $10000 price and the actual value, but I'll also throw in a bonus item worth $1000. What do you think?

I appreciate the offer, but I'm not sure I want to take on the same level of risk again. I just got lucky with the last product, and I don't want to rely on chance to make a profit. I'd like to see the next product and consider the risks and rewards before making another decision.

I understand your concerns, and I respect your caution. Since you're looking for a more informed decision, I'd like to offer you some additional information about this product. I've had multiple customers who have used this product and reported significant benefits, and I've received excellent feedback about its quality. I'm confident that this product will meet your expectations. However, I'm also willing to be transparent about the risks. If you're not satisfied with the product, I'll give you a full refund, no questions asked. What do you think?

I appreciate the additional information and the transparency, but I'm still not convinced. The fact that you're willing to give a full refund if I'm not satisfied doesn't change the fact that there's a 20% chance the product is worthless to me. I'd like to see the next product.

I understand your concerns, and I respect your decision. However, I'd like to offer you a different perspective. Instead of focusing on the potential risk, let's look at the potential upside. If this product is high-quality, it's worth $12500 to you, which is a significant gain. And with the full refund guarantee, you'll have no risk. You can think of it as a 'best-case scenario' opportunity. What do you think?
I understand your perspective, but I'm still not willing to take the risk. I've been burned twice already, and I don't want to rely on chance to make a profit. I'd like to see the next product.

I understand your concerns, and I respect your caution. However, I'd like to make one final offer. Since you've been hesitant to take the risk, I'm willing to meet you halfway. I'll give you a 10% discount on the price, making it $9000. This way, the potential upside is still significant, and the risk is even more manageable. What do you think?

I appreciate the discount, but I'm still not willing to take the risk. A 10% discount doesn't change the fact that there's a 20% chance the product is worthless to me. I'd like to see the next product.

Perhaps it's time to re-evaluate your risk assessment. The potential upside is still significant, and the guarantee is still in place. What do you think?
